perturbation.original_text: 3.  Capital Contributions. Except as agreed upon by mutual consent, the Joint Venturers shall not be required to make any capital contribution to the Joint Venture.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.  Capital Contributions. The Joint Venturers shall be required to make an initial capital contribution of $10,000 each to the Joint Venture. Further capital contributions may or may not be required, as agreed upon by mutual consent.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the original clause. The original stated that no capital contribution is required unless mutually agreed. The revision mandates an initial contribution, making the requirement unconditional, creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: 8.  Term of Joint Venture. The Joint Venture shall commence on the 1st of March, 2003, and shall be effective until February 28, 2004 unless extended by written agreement of the Joint Venturers not less than thirty (30) days prior to scheduled termination.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.  Term of Joint Venture. The Joint Venture shall commence on the 1st of March, 2003, and shall continue indefinitely, subject to termination by either party with thirty (30) days written notice. The Joint Venture shall commence on the 1st of March, 2003, and shall be effective until February 28, 2004 unless extended by written agreement of the Joint Venturers not less than thirty (30) days prior to scheduled termination.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity about the term of the joint venture. It states the venture continues indefinitely but also that it terminates on a specific date unless extended, creating a contradiction about the venture's lifespan.

perturbation.original_text: 12.  Sale or Purchase of Interest of Joint Venturer Prohibited. No Joint Venturer shall be authorized or empowered to mortgage, hypothecate, pledge, sell, or transfer, an interest in the Joint Venture, nor confer on any successor or assignee the right to become a Joint Venturer without the consent of the other Joint Venturer.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.  Sale or Purchase of Interest of Joint Venturer Prohibited. No Joint Venturer shall be authorized or empowered to mortgage, hypothecate, pledge, sell, or transfer, an interest in the Joint Venture, nor confer on any successor or assignee the right to become a Joint Venturer without the consent of the other Joint Venturer. However, each Joint Venturer retains the right to sell their interest to a third party provided they notify the other Joint Venturer of their intention in writing 30 days prior to the sale.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the sale of interest. The original prohibits selling without consent, but the addition allows selling with only a 30-day notice, regardless of the other party's consent. This introduces uncertainty regarding the ability to sell the interest
